page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: Most of the area in this D_block is in the parish of Hawley in Hart District, Hampshire. In 1981 the parish had a population of 7,781. Much of the land of the D_block is heaths, commons, and woods. Large areas are used for army training. The D_block lies on the edge of Farnborough and Fleet. Both places have seen their populations grow rapidly in recent years. Some new building associated with the expansion of these towns will take place inside the D_block in the near future. It seems likely however that it will retain its rural character for the foreseeable future.
